source: Vidneberetning i avisen Philadelphia Ledger, 20. April 1912
description: En gruppe overlevende fortæller om deres oplevelse, da skibet Titanic ramte et isbjerg og sank. Her fortæller Titanics barber om de sidste timer ombord.
quote1: Nobody was pushed off,
quote2: but as many as fifty dropped away,
quote3: unable to hang on any longer,
quote4: I never knew life was so cheap.
quote5: They gave up without a whimper.

source: Tale af George W. Bush holdt på U.S. Naval Academy, 30. November 2005
description: Irakkrigen startede i 2004 mens Bush var præsident i USA. Krigens årsager og konsekvenser diskuteres stadigvæk.
quote1: This is an enemy without conscience, and they cannot be appeased.
quote2: If we’re not fighting and destroying this enemy in Iraq,
quote3: they would not be idle.
quote4: They would be plotting and killing Americans across the world
quote5: and within our own borders.

source: Skuespillet Titus Andronicus af William Shakespeare
description: Stykket er blevet kendt for at indeholde et af de mest berømte ”din mor” jokes i verden.
quote1: AARON: Zounds, ye whore! is black so base a hue? Sweet blowse, you are a beauteous blossom, sure.
quote2: DEMETRIUS: Villain, what hast thou done?
quote3: AARONT: hat which thou canst not undo.
quote4: CHIRON: Thou hast undone our mother.
quote5: AARON: Villain, I have done thy mother.

source: Munken Girolamo Savonarolas tale efter udstødelse af kirken, 1498
description: Savonarolas kritiserede kirken hårdt og nægtede at anerkende pave Alexander VI. Han er således på sin vis en forløber for den protestantiske reformation. Han blev hængt og derefter brændt.
quote1: And I tell you
quote2: that a new time is coming;
quote3: and great wars are at hand and we must sustain
quote4: a more severe contest
quote5: than that in which we are now engaged.

source: Ronald W. Reagans tale ved Brandenburger Tor, 12. June 1987
description: Reagan opfordrer Sovjetunionens leder, Mikhail Gorbatjov, til, at rive Berlinmuren ned og forene Øst- og Vesttyskland igen.
quote1: There is one sign the Soviets can make that would be unmistakable,
quote2: that would advance dramatically the cause of freedom and peace.
quote3: General Secretary Gorbachev, if you seek peace, if you seek prosperity
quote4: for the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe, if you seek liberalization: Come here to this gate!
quote5: Mr. Gorbachev, open this gate! Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!

source: Præsident Lyndon B. Johnsons direkte TV tale fra Det hvide Hus, 31. marts 1968
description: Midt i den 20 år lange Vietnamkrig, troede amerikanerne stadigvæk på sejr. Det endte med at blive USAs historisk største nederlag.
quote1: I call upon President Ho Chi Minh to respond positively,
quote2: and favorably, to this new step toward peace.
quote3: But if peace does not come now through negotiations,
quote4: it will come when Hanoi understands that our common resolve is unshakable,
quote5: and our common strength is invincible.

source: Interview med præsident Bill Clinton, 12. juli 1997
description: Bill Clinton mødtes med statsminister Poul Nyrup Rasmussen på Christiansborg, for at diskutere de to landes roller i NATO.
quote1: Journalist: How do you like your visit?
quote2: The President: I love it. You know, I was last here in 1969 as a poor student,
quote3: and I had a wonderful time and I have never forgotten it.
quote4: I’ve always wanted to come back. I only wish I could stay longer,
quote5: especially because it’s so warm and the jazz festival is going on.”

source: Fra opfinderen Leonardo Da Vincis notesbøger
description: Da Vincis notesbøger er skrevet med venstre hånd i spejlvendt skrift og ofte i koder. Kun særligt værdige skulle kunne læse hans tanker.
quote1: Let no man
quote2: who is not
quote3: a Mathematician
quote4: read the elements
quote5: of my work.

source: Filosoffen Sokrates’ tale efter at være dømt til døden, år 339 f.v.t.
description: Sokrates holdt sin tale i Athen, da stod anklaget for håne guderne og fordærve ungdommen. Dommen blev dødsstraf. Hans to mest berømte elever var Platon og Aristoteles.
quote1: I say then to you,
quote2: O Athenians, who have condemned me to death,
quote3: that immediately after my death a punishment will overtake you,
quote4: far more severe, by Jupiter,
quote5: than that which you have inflicted on me.

source: Martin Luther Kings berømte tale i Washington D. C., 28. august 1963
description: Talen regnes for at være en af de mest betydningsfulde taler nogensinde. Der var streng raceadskillelse i USA's skoler og offentlige stede. Dette blev ophævet i 1964.
quote1: I have a dream
quote2: my four little children will one day live in a nation
quote3: where they will not be judged by the color of their skin
quote4: but by the content of their character.
quote5: I have a dream today!

source: Abraham Lincolns Gettysburg-tale i Gettysburg, 19. november 1863
description: Den amerikanske præsidents tale blev kendt for at omdefinere Den Amerikanske Borgerkrig fra blot at handle om at bevare Unionen til også at ville bringe sand lighed til alle borgere, uanset stat.
quote1: Four score and seven years ago,
quote2: our fathers brought forth upon this continent
quote3: a new nation:
quote4: conceived in liberty, and dedicated to the proposition
quote5: that all men are created equal.

source: Neville Chamberlain i avisen The Times, 30. September 1938
description: Den engelske premiereminister henviser til både Münchenaftalen og en fredsaftale mellem England og Nazityskland. Ingen af delene holdt og 2. verdenskrig startede året efter.
quote1: We regard the agreement signed last night
quote2: and the Anglo-German Naval Agreement
quote3: as symbolic of the desire
quote4: of our two peoples
quote5: never to go to war with one another again.

source: Barack Obamas indsættelsestale, 20 januar 2009
description: Obama holdt talen efter at være indsat som den 44. amerikanske præsident. Han blev den første afroamerikanske præsident nogensinde.
quote1: My fellow citizens,
quote2: I stand here today
quote3: humbled by the task before us,
quote4: grateful for the trust you have bestowed,
quote5: mindful of the sacrifices borne by our ancestors.

source: Fra bogen ”Principia Mathematica Philosophiae Naturalis”, 1687
description: Bogen indeholder fysikeren Isaac Newtons lov om gravitation, der blev grundlaget for klassisk mekanik. Den anses for at være et af de vigtigste værker i videnskabens historie.
quote1: Hitherto, we have explained
quote2: the phaenomena of the heavens and of our sea
quote3: by the power of gravity,
quote4: but have not yet
quote5: assigned the cause of this power.

source: Fra Thanenis dokumentation af Pharaoh Thutmose IIIs styre, 1479 f.v.t.
description: Thaneni var Thutmose IIIs personlige skribent. Han beskriver her slaget ved byen Megiddo, hvor Pharaohens tropper bekæmpede de syriske.  Megiddo hedder på græsk Armageddon (dommedag).
quote1: Arm yourselves!
quote2: Get your weapons ready,
quote3: for we shall set out
quote4: to do battle
quote5: with the miserable enemy at daybreak.

source: Fra Plinius Den Yngres breve, år 79
description: Den romerske admiral fortæller i detaljer om sine oplevelser under vulkanen Vesuvs udbrud. Pga. disse breve, ved vi hvad der skete under udbruddet, der i bogstavelig forstand forstenede hele byen Pompejis befolkning.
quote1: The ashes now began falling on us, though as yet in no great quantity.
quote2: I turned my head and saw behind me
quote3: a dense cloud which came rolling after us like a torrent.
quote4: I suggested that while we still had light we turn off the high road,
quote5: lest she be trampled to death in the dark by the crowd that followed us.

source: Primærkilde: Fra den filosofiske novelle ”Thus Spoke Zarathustra” af Friedrich Nietzsche, 1892
description: Filosoffen Nietzsche beskrev en supermand, der stod højere end mennesker. Det inspirerede, uden hans viden, både til nazisternes tanke om overmennesker og til tegneseriehelten Superman.
quote1: What is the ape to man?
quote2: A laughing-stock, a thing of shame.
quote3: And just the same shall man
quote4: be to the Superman:
quote5: a laughing-stock, a thing of shame.

source: Fra Charles Darwins videnskabelige udgivelse “Om Arternes Oprindelse”, 1859
description: Udgivelsen skabte stort postyr, da den sås som et opgør med religionens skabelsesteori. Den regnes for at ligge til grund for evolutionsteorien om arters udvikling over tid.
quote1: When we compare the individuals of the same variety
quote2: or sub-variety of our older cultivated plants and animals,
quote3: one of the first points which strikes us is,
quote4: that they generally differ more from each other
quote5: than do the individuals of any one species or variety in a state of nature.

source: Rapport om Trinitytesten af den amerikanske hær
description: Dr. Phillip Morrison fortæller om testsprængningen af verdens første atombombe den 16. juli 1945 i New Mexico. Bomben omdannede ørkensandet til glas, der stadig er for radioaktivt til at kunne berøres.
quote1: Suddenly, not only was there a bright light
quote2: but where we were, 10 miles away, there was the heat of the sun on our faces....
quote3: Then, only minutes later,
quote4: the real sun rose and again you felt the same heat to the face from the sunrise.
quote5: So we saw two sunrises.

source: Rapport fra kvinderettigheds konference, New York 19. og 20. juli 1848
description: Kampen om lige rettigheder for kvinder var i fuld gang på dette tidspunkt. I 1920 fik alle kvinder i USA stemmeret.
quote1: He has endeavored,
quote2: in every way that he could
quote3: to destroy her confidence in her own powers,
quote4: to lessen her self-respect, and to make her willing
quote5: to lead a dependent and abject life.

source: Fra bogen ”The General History” skrevet af John Smith, 1626
description: John Smith beskriver hvordan den indfødte amerikaner Pocahontas reddede hans liv. Det diskuteres om historien er sand. Smith blev aldrig gift med Pocahontas. Hun giftede sig med John Rolfe og kom til at hedde Rebecca.
quote1: Then as many as could laid hands on him, dragged him to them, and thereon laid his head,
quote2: and being ready with their clubs, to beat out his brains,
quote3: Pocahontas the king’s dearest daughter,
quote4: when no entreaty could prevail, got his head in her arms,
quote5: and laid her own upon his to save him from death.

source: Fra bogen ”Meditations on First Philosophy” af René Descartes, 1641
description: Filosoffen og matematikeren Descartes grundlagde den analytiske geometri. Det var ham, der opfandt det retvinklede koordinatsystem, som vi bruger det i dag.
quote1: Since in this life there are frequently greater rewards
quote2: held out to vice than to virtue,
quote3: few would prefer the right to the useful,
quote4: if they were restrained neither by the fear of God
quote5: nor the expectation of another life

source: Brev skrevet af Christopher Columbus til sin kollega, 1493
description: Kvinderne Columbus beskriver er oprindelige beboere på De Kanariske Øer. Hans breve giver et godt billede af, hvordan de opdagelsesrejsende betragtede lokalbefolkningen.
quote1: These women employ themselves in no labor suitable to their sex;
quote2: but use bows and arrows of cane
quote3: like those previously described,
quote4: and arm and cover themselves with plates of copper,
quote5: of which they have a great quantity.

source: Fra biografien ”Narrative of the Life of Frederick”, 1845
description: Den tidligere slave Frederick Douglass beskriver slavernes vilkår. Han var en vigtig stemme i kampen om slavernes frigørelse under Den Amerikanske Borgerkrig.
quote1: By far the larger part of the slaves
quote2: know as little of their ages
quote3: as horses know of theirs,
quote4: and it is the wish of most masters within my knowledge
quote5: to keep their slaves thus ignorant.

speech: Kaiser Wilhelm II and Czar Nicholas II
imageName: Kaiser Wilhelm II and Czar Nicholas II.jpg
source: Telegrammer sendt mellem Kaiser Wilhelm II and Czar Nicholas II, 1914
description: Den tyske kejser og den russiske zar var ikke kendt for at være gode venner. Men 1. verdenskrig var ved at bryde ud og de to var nødt til at kommunikere.
quote1: I have received your telegram and I share your desire for the preservation of peace.
quote2: However, I cannot - as I told you in my first telegram
quote3: - consider the action of Austria-Hungary as an ”ignominious war.”
quote4: Austria-Hungary knows from experience that the promises of Serbia,
quote5: as long as they are merely on paper, are entirely unreliable.

source: Japans kapitulationsdokument, 2. september 1945
description: Da USA den 6. august 1945 nedkastede en atombombe over byen Hiroshima og Sovjetunionen den 8. august 1945 erklærede dem krig, kapitulerede Japan. Det blev afslutningen på kampene under 2. verdenskrig.
quote1: We hereby proclaim the unconditional surrender
quote2: to the Allied Powers of the Japanese Imperial General Headquarters
quote3: and of all Japanese armed forces
quote4: and all armed forces
quote5: under the Japanese control wherever situated.

source: Præsident Woodrow Wilsons tale til USAs Kongres, 8. januar 1918
description: Talen indeholder fjorten punkter for genopbygningen af Europa efter første verdenskrig. Punkterne blev en del af Versaillestraktaten - en fredaftale mellem de allierede og Tyskland.
quote1: It will be our wish and purpose
quote2: that the processes of peace,
quote3: when they are begun,
quote4: shall be absolutely open and that they shall involve
quote5: and permit henceforth no secret understandings of any kind.

source: Julius Cæsars rapport til senatet om invasionen af England, 55 f.v.t.
description: Cæsar er navn og titel på de romerske kejsere i Rom. Gaius Julius Cæsar var den mest berømte af dem. Romerriget voksede betydeligt under hans styrer, bl.a. ved voldsomme krige.
quote1: At this moment, while our troops still hung back, chiefly on account of the depth of the sea,
quote2: the eagle-bearer of the Tenth Legion,
quote3: after a prayer to heaven to bless the legion by his act, cried:
quote4: 'Leap down, soldiers, unless you wish to betray your eagle to the enemy.
quote5: It shall be told that I at any rate did my duty to my country and my general.'

source: Genevekonventionen del II - General protection of prisoners of war, 1949
description: Genevekonventionen kaldes også for Krigens regler. Konventionen fra 1949 er den fjerde og omhandler beskyttelsen af civile i krig.
quote1: Prisoners of war must at all times be humanely treated.
quote2: Any unlawful act or omission by the Detaining Power
quote3: causing death or seriously endangering the health of a prisoner of war in its custody
quote4: is prohibited, and will be regarded as a serious breach
quote5: of the present Convention.
